channel.title: Health
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 The New York Times Company

item.title: Think Like a Doctor: The Painter’s Headaches Solved!
item.description: Readers solve the case of a painter with terrible headaches.
item.author: By LISA SANDERS, M.D.

item.title: How Is Your Family Coping With Delhi’s Air Pollution?
item.description: The Times would like to hear from parents whose children are staying home from school to avoid exposure to dangerous levels of air pollution.
item.author: By THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: Should Your Baby Really Sleep in the Same Room as You?
item.description: A look at the data behind new guidelines should reassure exhausted parents.
item.author: By CLAIRE CAIN MILLER and AARON E. CARROLL

item.title: Donors to Veterans’ Causes Face Crowded Field of Charities
item.description: Making sure contributions ultimately serve the needs of veterans requires due diligence as well as altruism.
item.author: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and NICHOLAS FANDOS

item.title: Pro Teams and Players Sign On With Causes
item.description: Often the motivation for giving is personal experience.
item.author: By KEN BELSON

item.title: Touring Central Park With Frankie Legs
item.description: Despite a childhood accident that badly broke his legs, Frankie Legarreta now makes a living with them. The man called Frankie Legs takes customers around Central Park and New York City all day in his pedicab.
item.author: By NOAH REMNICK and NEIL COLLIER

item.title: How Domenica Ramos, Marathon Runner, Spends Her Sundays
item.description: For the 33-year-old waitress, athlete and single mother, running comes first (before the sun rises) so she can fit in as many hours as possible with her daughter.
item.author: By LINDSAY CROUSE

item.title: Disgraced Hedge Fund Manager Focuses on Aiding Veterans
item.description: Prohibited from managing clients’ money, Steven Cohen, the hedge fund investor, turns to helping men and women who have served their country.
item.author: By PAUL SULLIVAN

item.title: Going to the Emergency Room Without Leaving the Living Room
item.description: Community paramedics are increasingly tending to older patients in their homes, solving problems there and eliminating costly ambulance trips.
item.author: By PAULA SPAN

item.title: News of Charges in Price-Fixing Inquiry Sends Pharmaceuticals Tumbling
item.description: Investors worry new controls may be in the offing as a news report says the Justice Department may bring charges by the end of the year.
item.author: By KATIE THOMAS
